clinical_study.brief_title: Oral Treatment for Post-operative Orthopaedic Pain With Dexketoprofen Trometamol and Tramadol Hydrochloride
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo and Active-controlled, Parallel-group Study to Evaluate the Analgesic Efficacy and Safety of Dexketoprofen Trometamol and Tramadol Hydrochloride Oral Fixed Combination on Moderate to Severe Acute Pain After Elective Unilateral Total Hip Arthroplasty

oversight_info.authority: Czech Republic: State Institute for Drug Control
Germany: Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices
India: Drugs Controller General of India
Lithuania: State Medicine Control Agency - Ministry of Health
Serbia: Medicines and Medical Devices Agency
Ukraine: State Pharmacological Center - Ministry of Health

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is designed as a randomised, double-blind, active and placebo controlled, parallel-group study to be conducted in approximately 47 sites; to confirm the analgesic efficacy and safety of a fixed combination of dexketoprofen trometamol (DKP) and tramadol hydrochloride (TRAM).
Approximately 600 male and female patients presenting moderate to severe pain after an elective primary hip arthroplasty will be randomised to a total of 6 treatment arms. Each arm includes single and multiple-dose phase treatments, as follows: 1) DKP+TRAM/ DKP+TRAM; 2) DKP/ DKP; 3) TRAM/TRAM; 4) Placebo/ DKP+TRAM; 5) Placebo / DKP; and 6) Placebo / TRAM with a 3:3:3:1:1:1 randomisation ratio. The double-blind treatment period lasts for 5 consecutive days.
Main variables for analgesic efficacy are pain intensity by visual analogue scale (PI-VAS) and pain relief verbal by rating scale (PAR-VRS). Safety will be assessed by monitoring of adverse events and clinical laboratory tests.
Overall the study encompasses 3-4 planned visits at site, including screening, surgery and treatment period and final follow up visits.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: SPID8 (Sum of Pain Intensity Differences over 8 hours)
primary_outcome.time_frame: over 8 hours after the first dose
primary_outcome.description: Sum of Pain Intensity Differences calculated as the weighted sum of the PI-VAS (pain intensity measured by a visual analogue scale) differences.

secondary_outcome.measure: SPID48 (Sum of Pain Intensity Differences over 48 hours of the multiple-dose phase)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: over 48 hours of the multiple-dose phase
secondary_outcome.description: Sum of Pain Intensity Differences calculated as the weighted sum of the PI-VAS (pain intensity measured by a visual analogue scale) differences) over 48 hours of the multiple-dose phase

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of responders according to PI-VAS (Pain Intensity - Visual Analogue Scale)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: over 48 hours of the multiple-dose phase
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of responders (response defined as achievement a mean pain intensity measured by a visual analogue scale PI-VAS < 40 mm), over 48 hours of the multiple-dose phase

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of responders according to 50% max TOTPAR (Total Pain Relief)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: over 8 hours after the first dose
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of responders over 8 hours after first dose, according to the 50% maximum total pain relief rule: maximum TOTPAR calculated as the theoretical maximum weighted sum of PAR-VRS (Pain Relief - Verbal Rating Scale) scores

arm_group.description: Drug: Placebo - single dose phase Drug: Tramadol Hydrochloride - multiple dose phase Arm type: single: PLACEBO comparator / multiple: active comparator
Drug: Placebo - single dose phase Drug: Dexketoprofen trometamol - multiple dose phase Arm type: single: PLACEBO comparator / multiple: active comparator
Drug: Placebo - single dose phase Drug: Dexketoprofen trometamol and Tramadol Hydrochloride - multiple dose phase Arm type: single: PLACEBO comparator / multiple: experimental
Drug: Tramadol Hydrochloride - single dose phase Drug: Tramadol Hydrochloride - multiple dose phase
Drug: Dexketoprofen trometamol - single dose phase Drug: Dexketoprofen trometamol - multiple dose phase
Drug: Dexketoprofen trometamol and Tramadol Hydrochloride - single dose phase Drug: Dexketoprofen trometamol and Tramadol Hydrochloride - multiple dose phase

intervention.description: One dose of Placebo during single dose phase (first 8 hours)
One oral dose of Tramadol Hydrochloride (TRAM) during single dose phase (first 8 hours)
One oral dose of Dexketoprofen trometamol (DKP) during single dose phase (first 8 hours)

intervention.intervention_name: Dexketoprofen trometamol and Tramadol Hydrochloride - single dose phase
intervention.description: One oral dose of Dexketoprofen trometamol and Tramadol Hydrochloride (DKP + TRAM) during single dose phase (first 8 hours)
Oral dose of Tramadol Hydrochloride (TRAM) every 8 hours during multiple dose phase (from day 1 to day 5)
Oral dose of Dexketoprofen trometamol (DKP) every 8 hours during multiple dose phase (from day 1 to day 5)

intervention.intervention_name: Dexketoprofen trometamol and Tramadol Hydrochloride - multiple dose phase
intervention.description: Oral dose of Dexketoprofen trometamol and Tramadol Hydrochloride (DKP+TRAM) every 8 hours during multiple dose phase (from day 1 to day 5)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female patients aged 18 to 80 years. Females participating in the study must be either of non-childbearing potential, or willing to use a highly effective contraceptive method.
- Scheduled to undergo standard primary (first-time) one-sided total hip replacement surgery due to primary osteoarthritis.
- Patients experiencing pain at rest of at least moderate intensity the day after surgery.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients not suitable for study treatments and rescue medication (RM) or those for whom non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), opioids, acetyl salicylic acid, pyrazolones or pyrazolidines are contraindicated.
- Patients with clinically significant abnormalities in vital signs, safety laboratory tests and 12-lead ECG at screening.
- Patients with history of any illness or condition that might pose a risk to the patient or confound the efficacy and safety study results.
- Patients using and not suitable to withdraw analgesics other than those specified in the protocol.
- Patients using and not suitable for withdrawing any of the prohibited medication specified in the protocol.
- Pregnant and breastfeeding women.
